results.title: Dorothy Heathcote talks to teachers. Pt. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bernice Gregorio, Dana H. Hodgdon and Northwestern University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
Drama in the classroom continues with the discussion of techniques developed by Mrs. Heathcote. “Questioning”, “storyline”, “universals” and “brother hoods” are examined. Drama is related to developing language and social skills, while teaching subject material. Mrs. Heathcote’s educative process is based on total involvement that ultimately modifies behaviour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bernice Gregorio, Dana H. Hodgdon and Northwestern University

results.title: Glass curtain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Doris Chase Concepts”.
A dance film in which a woman tries to cope with the dimming mind of her mother who suffers from Alzheimer’s disease. Dancer Jennie Ventriss. Music by Katherine Hoover.

results.title: Afraid of school
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Psychiatrist Dr. Taylor discusses Tommy, a six year old boy who is afraid of attending school. Interviews with Tommy and his parents eventually reveal the cause and help Tommy overcome his fear.

results.title: Afraid of school: a case of school phobia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Tommy, aged six, refuses to go to school and is obsessed with thoughts of death and dying. After bribery, persuasion and spanking, his desperate parents seek psychiatric help at a children’s hospital. Both Tommy and his parents receive counselling, and learn to come to grips with his going to school. Psychiatrist: Taylor Statten, MD.

results.title: A Coronary
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Disordered Mind”.
The case of a successful 34 year old insurance salesman whose inner conflicts trigger a heart attack. The patient talks with Dr. Harold N. Segall, who describes the damage to the heart. The patient is interviewed by psychiatrist Dr. Henry Kravitz and a clear picture of the patient’s emotional background emerges bearing directly on the heart attack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Anderson, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates

results.title: A Depression
results.creator_credit: Henwar Rodakiewicz, Robert Anderson and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
The case of a young man shown during and after recovery from a severe depression. The patient attempted to kill his wife, son and himself. He is interviewed by a psychiatrist and the prognosis and treatment are discussed. After a course of drugs and psychiatric treatment there is a remarkable improvement.

results.title: Psychoneurotic conditions: obsessive-compulsive neurosis
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Disordered Mind”.
Presents the case-history of a middle-aged man who, despite good education and intellect has been unable to hold a job during the five years prior to the start of treatment for an obsessive-compulsive neurosis. Includes the patient’s feelings about his symptoms and his progress in therapy.
